requests.title: User Requests
requests.description: Review and manage user requests for artist linking, data deletion, and more.
requests.approveDescLinkArtist: This will link the artist "{{artistName}}" to the user's account. They will be able to manage this artist profile.
requests.approveDescDeleteData: This will permanently delete the artist profile and all associated data including recordings, genre associations, and event appearances. This action cannot be undone.
requests.approveDescUnlinkArtist: This will unlink the artist from the user's account. The artist profile will remain but won't be associated with this user.
requests.approveDescDeleteVenue: This will permanently delete the venue "{{venueName}}" and all associated data. This action cannot be undone.
requests.approveDescDeleteArtist: This will permanently delete the artist "{{artistName}}" and all associated data including recordings, genre associations, and event appearances. This action cannot be undone.
requests.approveDescDeleteOrganization: This will permanently delete the organization "{{organizationName}}" and all associated data. This action cannot be undone.
requests.denyDescription: Please provide a reason for denying this request. This will be visible to the user.

ticketing.description: Configure ticketing fees and checkout behavior
ticketing.checkoutTimerTooltip: The checkout timer creates urgency during the purchase flow. When enabled, users have a limited time to complete their purchase. You can override this duration per-event in the event's queue configuration.
ticketing.toggleInFeatureFlags: Toggle in Feature Flags ‚Üí "Event Checkout Timer"
ticketing.durationHelperText: Time users have to complete checkout. Can be overridden per-event.
ticketing.enableFeatureFlagHint: Enable the "Event Checkout Timer" feature flag in Site Settings to configure this option.
ticketing.confirmChangesDescription: This will update ticketing settings in the database for all environments.
ticketing.feeChangesWarning: Fee changes will affect all future ticket purchases.
ticketing.timerChangesWarning: Timer changes will affect all future checkouts.

upload.enterDirectUrl: Enter a direct URL to an external image

upload.enterValidUrl: Please enter a valid URL starting with http:// or https://

publish.confirmDescription: Once published, this event will be visible to the public and ticket sales can begin. This action will make your event appear on the home page and allow customers to purchase tickets.

validation.codeMinLength: Code must be at least 3 characters
validation.codePattern: Only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens

utmDescriptions.source: Identifies which site or platform sent the traffic (e.g., instagram, google, newsletter)
utmDescriptions.medium: Identifies the marketing channel or type (e.g., social, email, cpc, banner)
utmDescriptions.campaign: Identifies the specific promotion or campaign name (e.g., summer_sale, launch_2024)
utmDescriptions.content: Differentiates similar content or links within the same ad (e.g., banner_a, text_link)
utmDescriptions.term: Identifies paid search keywords (e.g., electronic+music, techno+events)

queue.title: Queue configuration
queue.description: Control checkout behavior for this specific event
queue.resetConfirm: This will remove the custom queue configuration for this event and revert to the global defaults. Continue?
queue.enableQueueDescription: Control user flow during high-traffic ticket sales
queue.maxConcurrentUsersTooltip: Maximum number of users who can be in the checkout process simultaneously. Others will be queued until a spot opens up.
queue.checkoutTimerTooltip: Time users have to complete checkout. Leave empty to use the global default ({{minutes}} minutes).
queue.sessionTimeoutTooltip: How long a user's queue session remains valid if they leave and return.
queue.wellGetYouIn: We'll get you in as soon as possible
queue.loseYourPlace: You'll lose your place in the queue if you leave this page

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.content: By purchasing tickets through Force Majeure, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. Please read them carefully before completing your purchase. If you do not agree to these terms, you should not purchase tickets.

section2.title: 2. Ticket Purchase and Pricing
section2.content1: All ticket sales are final. Ticket prices are subject to service fees, processing fees, and applicable taxes. The total price displayed at checkout includes all mandatory fees and charges.
section2.content2: We reserve the right to cancel orders and refuse service to anyone at any time for any reason, including suspected fraudulent activity.

section3.title: 3. Ticket Delivery
section3.content: Tickets will be delivered electronically to the email address provided at checkout. It is your responsibility to ensure the email address is accurate. Please check your spam folder if you do not receive your tickets within 24 hours of purchase.

section4.title: 4. Refunds and Cancellations
section4.content1: All ticket sales are final and non-refundable except in the following circumstances:
section4.list1: The event is cancelled and not rescheduled
section4.list2: The event is rescheduled and you cannot attend the new date
section4.list3: You purchased Ticket Protection and have a qualifying reason
section4.content2: Refund requests must be submitted within the timeframes specified in our refund policy. Processing fees are non-refundable.

section5.title: 5. Event Changes
section5.content: Event date, time, location, and lineup are subject to change without notice. We will notify ticket holders of any significant changes via email. Minor changes to the event (such as supporting acts) do not qualify for refunds.

section6.title: 6. Entry Requirements
section6.content1: You must comply with all venue rules and regulations. Entry requirements may include:
section6.content2: The venue and event organizers reserve the right to refuse entry or remove anyone who does not comply with entry requirements or behaves inappropriately.

section7.title: 7. Ticket Validity and Transfer
section7.content: Tickets are valid only for the specific event, date, and time indicated. Tickets obtained from unauthorized sources may be invalid. Resale of tickets for profit is prohibited unless through our official resale platform. We reserve the right to cancel tickets obtained through unauthorized channels without refund.

section8.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
section8.content: Force Majeure, event organizers, and venues are not liable for any injury, loss, or damage to persons or property occurring at the event. Attendance is at your own risk. We are not responsible for any costs incurred as a result of event cancellation, postponement, or changes, including but not limited to travel, accommodation, or other related expenses.

section9.title: 9. Force Majeure
section9.content: We are not liable for failure to perform our obligations due to circumstances beyond our reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, natural disasters, war, terrorism, riots, civil unrest, strikes, government restrictions, or public health emergencies.

section10.title: 10. Recording and Photography
section10.content: Professional recording equipment and cameras may be prohibited at events. By attending, you consent to being filmed, photographed, or recorded, and grant us the right to use such recordings for promotional purposes without compensation.

section11.title: 11. Privacy and Data Protection
section11.content: Your personal information will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy. By purchasing tickets, you consent to receiving transactional emails related to your order and event updates. You may opt out of marketing communications at any time.

section12.title: 12. Prohibited Items and Behavior
section12.content1: The following items and behaviors are prohibited at all events:
section12.list3: Outside food and beverages (unless medically necessary)
section12.list5: Discrimination or harassment of any kind

section13.title: 13. Dispute Resolution
section13.content: Any disputes arising from these Terms and Conditions or your ticket purchase will be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction where Force Majeure operates. You waive your right to participate in class action lawsuits.

section14.title: 14. Changes to Terms
section14.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting to our website. Your continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of any changes.

section15.title: 15. Contact Information
section15.content: For questions about these Terms and Conditions or your ticket purchase, please contact us at support@forcemajeure.com.
